str2: Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To force, compel, constrain, urge. From anagke; to necessitate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
To step in; I go onboard a ship, embark. From en and the base of basis; to walk on, i.e. Embark, reach.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.
From pro and ago; to lead forward; intransitively, to precede (participle, previous).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Over, on the other side, beyond. Apparently accusative case of an obsolete derivative of peiro; through, i.e. Across.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
